segments.text: I want to check out today . My plane leaves at 3 p . m .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Which room are you staying in now , sir ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am in Room 205 . My name is Bill Smith . When shall I check out ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Usually if you are leaving today , you'd better check out before 12 noon , and leave the room . If you check out after 12 noon , we will count one day more .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Since your plane leaves at 3 p . m . it will be too early for you to leave the hotel at 12 0 ' clock . We can arrange you to stay in the room until 1 p . m . ; but first you should still check out before 12 noon .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's very considerate of you . May I have my bill ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Your bill comes to 60 dollars . How would you like it to be paid ? With cash or credit card ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'd like it to be charged to my credit card .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Would you please give to me , and will imprint it ?
segments.speaker: S2
